abstract: The lawsuit against Yahoo’s board over its rebuff of Microsoft’s $47.5 billion buyout bid was made public by a judge who said that Yahoo had not shown good reason to keep it confidential.
snippet: The lawsuit against Yahoo’s board over its rebuff of Microsoft’s $47.5 billion buyout bid was made public by a judge who said that Yahoo had not shown good reason to keep it confidential.
lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO  Yahoo’s chief executive, Jerry Yang, pushed for an expensive plan to retain employees in the event of an acquisition by Microsoft despite reservations of some Yahoo executives and of a consulting firm that Yahoo hired to help devise the plan, according to a shareholder lawsuit.
